item.title: Is calling someone fool more grave than murder?
item.dc:creator: brodneil
item.content:encoded:
Good day.

This is another Bible passage that I'd like to share. Again, most of the inputs are taken from BibleScholars.org.

This is about what Yeshua means in Matthew 5:21-26, when he said about being subject to judgment.

What does judgment mean in this context?  Is it the final judgment in the end days? Or is it something else?

Please walk with me in this journey of trying to understand the context of what Yeshua (Jesus) meant in this passage.

Without a knowledge of Hebrew, it is quite difficult to understand its context.  And thus, it might be wise to learn from Hebrew scholars themselves rather than just relying on the English translation to better understand the meaning and its context.

Below is the passage in Matthew 5:21-26:

21 Ye have heard that it was said of them of old time, Thou shalt not kill; and whosoever shall kill shall be in danger of the judgment:

22 But I say unto you, That whosoever is angry with his brother without a cause shall be in danger of the judgment: and whosoever shall say to his brother, Raca, shall be in danger of the council: but whosoever shall say, Thou fool, shall be in danger of hell fire.

23 Therefore if thou bring thy gift to the altar, and there rememberest that thy brother hath ought against thee;

24 Leave there thy gift before the altar, and go thy way; first be reconciled to thy brother, and then come and offer thy gift.

25 Agree with thine adversary quickly, whiles thou art in the way with him; lest at any time the adversary deliver thee to the judge, and the judge deliver thee to the officer, and thou be cast into prison.

26 Verily I say unto thee, Thou shalt by no means come out thence, till thou hast paid the uttermost farthing.

 

Note that in the Hebrew text of Matthew, the word judgment is bet din for this verse: "Ye have heard that it was said of them of old time, Thou shalt not kill; and whosoever shall kill shall be in danger of the judgment:."

For the 1st part of the next verse: "But I say unto you, That whosoever is angry with his brother without a cause shall be in danger of the judgment: and whosoever shall say to his brother, Raca, shall be in danger of the council," the word in English texts are usually translated as council, court, or judgment.  In Hebrew, it is san herding (Sanhedrin).

And then for the next part of that same verse: "but whosoever shall say, Thou fool, shall be in danger of hell fire," the word fool in Hebrew is naval, and the word hell is gehinom.

Why are those words significant?  Without understanding the Hebrew context, we would have no idea of what was really implied.

According to Dr. Blizzard, who has a Ph.D. in Hebrew studies, there are three Sanhedrin (or  Sanhedrins):

  • The first and small Sanhedrin is called the bet din, translated in English as judgment in verse 21;
  • The second Sanhedrin is composed of 23 judges;
  • The third Sanhedrin consists of 71 members.

It was explained that:

Each Sanhedrin judges certain specific offenses and all of the laws regarding the number of judges and a specific offenses each Sanhedrin judges are listed in the tractate Sanhedrin. This is the first injunction referring to a transgression of such offense that the one violating the injunction is deemed worthy of eternal punishment.

But what is naval, which is translated as fool?  What made calling another person, "you fool" far worst than murder?

In the Tanakh (called Old Testament by Christians), the word fool is apparently used to describe an atheist:

The fool says in his heart, “There is no God.”

Again according to Hebrew Bible scholars,  "The fact it mentions the naval is a specific indication that this information was communicated originally, not in Greek but Hebrew... In biblical literature the statement ‘there is no god’ is made by the naval (f00l), i.e. the morally corrupt person who, while acknowledging the existence of a creator, refused to believe that he was at all interested in the actions of his creature... TheRabbis define the atheist as one who affirmed 'there is no judgement and no judge (gen.R.266)' in the universe irrespective of his disbelief in the existence of God."

With that, we may now have a clearer perspective why calling "you fool" has more gravity.

Personally, I would say that murder is judged in a human court and punished in a human prison; while living as an atheist or naming someone an atheist is judged not in our human court and punished not in our human prison.

If we continue reading the rest of the verses, we are invited to be forgiving and sensible.  In a way, verse 25 supports that the word judgment in verse 21 is indeed the Sanhedrin.

 

Whether you and I would consider the context that we have discussed --- we all know that to forgive sets both parties free.  The forgiven is set free, not perhaps of the punishment and verdict, yet of the guilt; while the one who forgives is set free of that hatred that can seriously kill not just the soul, but also the body and the mind.

 

 

 

About BibleScholars.org:

BibleScholars.org is the website of Dr. Roy B. Blizzard.  He is President of Bible Scholars, which is an Austin-based corporation dedicated to biblical research and education.  Dr. Blizzard has a Ph.D. in Hebrew Studies from the University of Texas at Austin.
item.excerpt:encoded: What does Jesus meant about the passage? Is calling someone a fool as grave as murder? Join me as I try to learn the context it was written. I am simply learning and trying to share what I am learning.

item.title: Why Read the Bible?
item.dc:creator: brodneil
item.content:encoded:
For I am not ashamed of the Good News, since it is God’s powerful means of bringing salvation to everyone who keeps on trusting, to the Jew especially, but equally to the Gentile.

Romans 1:16

Reflection:

I use the bible to guide me in life, like a guide book to life, a guide book to knowing God. Throughout the years, the bible has served me well to a happy, peaceful, and abundant life.

Why do you read the bible?

item.title: Psalm 32:8 God's Assurance
item.dc:creator: brodneil
item.content:encoded:
8 “I will instruct and teach you
in this way that you are to go;
I will give you counsel;
my eyes will be watching you.”

Reflection:

Have you experienced waking up in the morning and all you can think of is work?   Well, this happened to me earlier this morning. I was a bit anxious about a certain project that I almost forgot to do my daily routine.  (I presume many others have some sort of routine as well.)

Fortunately, I decided to dismiss the thought and start with my Bible passage reading.   And I'm glad that I did it.

The passage above is very appropriate to what I need for the day.  This is not the first of the many "coincidences" that God speaks to me through Bible passages.   The bible passage is just the assurance that I really need.

Thank you God.  Gadol Elohai.

item.title: Trust God and Follow His Rules
item.dc:creator: brodneil
item.content:encoded:
Psalm 119:30

30 I choose the way of trust;
I set your rulings [before me].

Reflection:

Do we trust God?  Do we trust Him in providing for us? Do we trust in His divine providence? Do we follow his ruling and commandments while trusting Him?

item.title: A Warning to Take Heed
item.dc:creator: brodneil
item.content:encoded:
Matthew 24

24 As Yeshua left the Temple and was going away, his talmidim came and called his attention to its buildings. 2 But he answered them, “You see all these? Yes! I tell you, they will be totally destroyed — not a single stone will be left standing!”

3 When he was sitting on the Mount of Olives, the talmidim came to him privately. “Tell us,” they said, “when will these things happen? And what will be the sign that you are coming, and that the ‘olam hazeh is ending?”

4 Yeshua replied: “Watch out! Don’t let anyone fool you! 5 For many will come in my name, saying, ‘I am the Messiah!’ and they will lead many astray. 6 You will hear the noise of wars nearby and the news of wars far off; see to it that you don’t become frightened. Such things must happen, but the end is yet to come. 7 For peoples will fight each other, nations will fight each other, and there will be famines and earthquakes in various parts of the world; 8 all this is but the beginning of the ‘birth-pains.’ 9 At that time you will be arrested and handed over to be punished and put to death, and all peoples will hate you because of me. 10 At that time many will be trapped into betraying and hating each other, 11 many false prophets will appear and fool many people; 12 and many people’s love will grow cold because of increased distance from Torah. 13 But whoever holds out till the end will be delivered. 14 And this Good News about the Kingdom will be announced throughout the whole world as a witness to all the Goyim. It is then that the end will come.

15 “So when you see the abomination that causes devastation spoken about through the prophet Dani’el standing in the Holy Place”[a] (let the reader understand the allusion), 16 “that will be the time for those in Y’hudah to escape to the hills. 17 If someone is on the roof, he must not go down to gather his belongings from his house; 18 if someone is in the field, he must not turn back to get his coat. 19 What a terrible time it will be for pregnant women and nursing mothers! 20 Pray that you will not have to escape in winter or on Shabbat. 21 For there will be trouble then worse than there has ever been from the beginning of the world until now, and there will be nothing like it again![b] 22 Indeed, if the length of this time had not been limited, no one would survive; but for the sake of those who have been chosen, its length will be limited.

23 “At that time, if someone says to you, ‘Look! Here’s the Messiah!’ or, ‘There he is!’ don’t believe him. 24 For there will appear false Messiahs and false prophets performing great miracles — amazing things! — so as to fool even the chosen, if possible. 25 There! I have told you in advance! 26 So if people say to you, ‘Listen! He’s out in the desert!’ don’t go; or, ‘Look! He’s hidden away in a secret room!’ don’t believe it. 27 For when the Son of Man does come, it will be like lightning that flashes out of the east and fills the sky to the western horizon. 28 Wherever there’s a dead body, that’s where you find the vultures.

29 “But immediately following the trouble of those times,

the sun will grow dark,
the moon will stop shining,[c]
the stars will fall from the sky,
and the powers in heaven will be shaken. [d]

30 “Then the sign of the Son of Man will appear in the sky, all the tribes of the Land will mourn,[e] and they will see the Son of Man coming on the clouds of heaven with tremendous power and glory.[f] 31 He will send out his angels with a great shofar;[g] and they will gather together his chosen people from the four winds, from one end of heaven to the other.

32 “Now let the fig tree teach you its lesson: when its branches begin to sprout and leaves appear, you know that summer is approaching. 33 In the same way, when you see all these things, you are to know that the time is near, right at the door. 34 Yes! I tell you that this people will certainly not pass away before all these things happen. 35 Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will never pass away.

36 “But when that day and hour will come, no one knows — not the angels in heaven, not the Son, only the Father. 37 For the Son of Man’s coming will be just as it was in the days of Noach. 38 Back then, before the Flood, people went on eating and drinking, taking wives and becoming wives, right up till the day Noach entered the ark; 39 and they didn’t know what was happening until the Flood came and swept them all away. It will be just like that when the Son of Man comes. 40 Then there will be two men in a field — one will be taken and the other left behind. 41 There will be two women grinding flour at the mill — one will be taken and the other left behind. 42 So stay alert, because you don’t know on what day your Lord will come. 43 But you do know this: had the owner of the house known when the thief was coming, he would have stayed awake and not allowed his house to be broken into. 44 Therefore you too must always be ready, for the Son of Man will come when you are not expecting him.

45 “Who is the faithful and sensible servant whose master puts him in charge of the household staff, to give them their food at the proper time? 46 It will go well with that servant if he is found doing his job when his master comes. 47 Yes, I tell you that he will put him in charge of all he owns. 48 But if that servant is wicked and says to himself, ‘My master is taking his time’; 49 and he starts beating up his fellow servants and spends his time eating and drinking with drunkards; 50 then his master will come on a day the servant does not expect, at a time he doesn’t know; 51 and he will cut him in two and put him with the hypocrites, where people will wail and grind their teeth!

Reflection:

Reading this chapter in Matthew is quite scary.  At the same time, it is a blessing for we have been warned.

Though no one exactly knows the day and the hour except YHWH, our Father in Heaven --- we are given signs when the time is near:

To all the Goyim (nations/peoples):

  • Many will come in my name, saying, ‘I am the Messiah!’ and they will lead many astray;
  • You will hear the noise of wars nearby and the news and rumors of wars far off;
  • Peoples will fight each other;
  • Nations will fight each other;
  • There will be famines and earthquakes in various parts of the world;
  • You will be arrested and handed over to be punished and put to death, and all peoples will hate you because of me (Who is you in this text? Does you mean the believers of Yeshua?);
  • Many will be trapped into betraying and hating each other;
  • Many false prophets will appear and fool many people;
  • Many people’s love will grow cold because of increased distance from Torah (Does it mean that families will be divided because of their faith in the Torah?);

To all those in Y'hudah (Judah/Israel):

  • When you see the abomination that causes devastation spoken about through the prophet Dani’el standing in the Holy Place --- that will be the time for those in Y’hudah to escape to the hills;
  • There will appear false Messiahs and false prophets performing great miracles — amazing things! — so as to fool even the chosen, if possible;

When the Son of Man does come, it will be like lightning that flashes out of the east and fills the sky to the western horizon. Immediately following the trouble of those times (the signs of those times):

  • the sun will grow dark,
  • the moon will stop shining,
  • the stars will fall from the sky, and
  • the powers in heaven will be shaken.

Therefore we don't really know the exact time except for the signs that the time is near.  So I guess we just have to be prepared of the messiah's coming every moment of our lives by:

  • doing what is right,
  • loving mercy, and
  • walking humbly with our God.

Is it the beginning of the birth pangs or birth pains? Is it near? I don't know.  Let us continue to keep watch basing on the warnings given to us by Yeshua.
item.excerpt:encoded: Reading this chapter in Matthew is quite scary. At the same time, it is a blessing for we have been warned.

item.title: When Feeling Depressed, Know that God Loves You
item.dc:creator: brodneil
item.content:encoded:
Aren’t sparrows sold for next to nothing, five for two assarions? And not one of them has been forgotten by God. Why, every hair on your head has been counted! Don’t be afraid, you are worth more than many sparrows.

Luke 12:6-7

Reflection:

When depressed or feeling down, remember that you have a God on your side.   When you feel like thrown to the deepest well, remember and believe that there is a God who can rescue you.  Call Him.

When your solutions don't work, seek guidance from God.  Surrender your plans and get ready to solve them His way.  His solution is the best for you; more than you'll ever know.

Trust God. He loves you.

item.title: A Life of Good Actions Already Prepared for Us
item.dc:creator: brodneil
item.content:encoded:
Ephesians 2:10

For we are of God’s making, created in union with the Messiah Yeshua for a life of good actions already prepared by God for us to do.

Reflection:

I believe that we are all unique; and each one of us is called for a specific purpose that no one else can do. No matter how seemingly similar our task or calling is to another, he or she cannot do it the way I do; and I can't do it the way he or she can do.  We are called for a specific purpose.  Two great singers can sing the same song. Yet each has his/her way of delivering and expressing the song.

We (you) are all called for a life of good actions; already prepared for us by God for a specific purpose that only we as individuals (you) can do it in the manner specifically entrusted to us (you).

Ask God our father through Yeshua your purpose.  Then you will find the meaning and happiness that you have been looking for.

item.title: All Glory to You Alone
item.dc:creator: brodneil
item.content:encoded:
All glory to You alone!

You, creator of the heavens.

All glory to You alone!

You, creator of the earth.

 

All glory to You alone!

You, who is feared by all angels.

All glory to You alone!

You, who loves Israel.

 

All glory to You Alone!

You, where abundance flow.

All glory to You Alone!

You, the source of life.

 

All glory to You alone!

You, YHWH, my God.
item.excerpt:encoded: A short poem entitled "All Glory to You Alone." There is poetry in prayer.

item.title: Bear One Another's Burdens
item.dc:creator: brodneil
item.content:encoded:
Galatians 6:2 (Galatiym 6:2)

Bear ye one another's burdens, and so fulfill the Torah of Mashiach (the Annointed Messiah).

 

Bear one another's burdens.

Doing so, your troubles are unburdened.

Bear one another's burdens.

Earthly things, no need to overburden.

 

Bear one another's burdens.

Are we not ask to do so.

Bear one another's burdens.

Why act so slow.

 

Bear one another's burdens.

A sign of God's love.

Bear one another's burdens.

Peace of mind, we all should have.

 

Bear one another's burdens.

Makes the burden less heavy.

Bear one another's burdens.

Takes sorrow away and removes envy.

 

What a joyful world it could have been.

If bearing one another's burdens is all that we've seen.
item.excerpt:encoded: Inspired to write this after reading a Bible passage in Galatians 6:2: "Bear ye one another's burdens, and so fulfill the Torah of Mashiach (the Annointed Messiah)." May this also serve as your prayer when reading it.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Inspired to write this after reading a Bible passage in Galatians 6:2: "Bear ye one another's burdens, and so fulfill the Torah of Mashiach."

item.title: Rise Up Men of God
item.dc:creator: brodneil
item.content:encoded:
Rise up, you men of God.

Why stay in slumber.

Rise up, you men of God.

Do not cower behind your altars.

 

Rise up, you men of God.

God is with you.

Rise up, you men of God.

Not your power, but His might.

 

Rise up, you men of God.

Wait not for the last days.

Rise up, you men of God.

The time is now.

 

Rise up, you men of God.

Your faith is as cold as ice.

Rise up, you men of God.

Can heat melt your faith?

 

Rise up, you men of God.

Show God's love and greatness.

Rise up, you men of God.

God's love is eternal.

 

Rise up, you men of God.

He is ready to forgive.

Rise up, you men of God.

In Him we find strength.

 

Rise up, you men of God.

For YHWH is our God.

Rise you, men of God.

For we are His people.
item.excerpt:encoded: A prayer to wake God's children from slumber and fear of condemnation. There is poetry in prayer by Shalom101.com

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: A prayer to wake God's children from slumber and fear of condemnation. There is poetry in prayer by Shalom101.com

item.title: Wisdom and Understanding
item.dc:creator: brodneil
item.content:encoded:
Gain wisdom and understanding by revering what is holy and by fearing the Lord, YHWH.

Proverbs 9:10

The fear of Adonai (YHWH) is the beginning of wisdom: and the knowledge of the holy is understanding.

 

Worship not on idols,

and trust not in your amulets.

They are as useless as decorative vases.

 

Boast not in your achievements,

and pride not in your wealth.

They are as fleeting as the leaves in autumn.

 

Fear the Lord,

and strive to follow His commands.

It is the beginning of wisdom.

 

Revere what is holy,

and learn from His words.

Through the scripture, you gain understanding.

item.title: Guilty
item.dc:creator: brodneil
item.content:encoded:
They condemned him,

For they said he was guilty!

They tortured him,

For they said he was guilty!

 

They mocked him,

For they thought he was guilty!

They crucified him,

For they thought he was guilty!

 

They sought and awaited,

The messiah they could not find.

They awaited and longed for.

He came, and they were left behind.

 

For when he comes back,

We all should be prepared.

For guilty should we be,

if unprepared and running scared.

 

Let us remember though,

that guilty we all have been.

Through his death and resurrection,

we are all forgiven.

 

Because of his love,

Paid by his blood,

We are made free.

Our sins are forgiven.

 

So now let us await for him,

And sin no more.

This time on his second coming,

Lamps are lighted and adorned.
item.excerpt:encoded: May you find poetry in this prayer. May it bring joy and anticipation on our Messiah's comings. There can be poetry in prayer by Shalom101.com

item.title: Goodbye My Friend-Brother, Goodbye
item.dc:creator: brodneil
item.content:encoded:
May you forgive his sins;

And may you take him my Lord,

So you be worshiped and adored.

 

May he be with you in heaven;

And enter the gates of your kingdom,

Where lies true freedom.

 

May this be a prayer,

For a close friend so rare.

Your love and forgiveness, I know he won't despair.

 

You, my Lord, are his salvation,

And that's my consolation.

Finally he has arrived at his final destination.

 

To my dearest friend-brother,

Goodbye my friend-brother goodbye.

item.title: Morning Prayer: When Morning Comes
item.dc:creator: brodneil
item.content:encoded:
When morning comes,

And the day has just begun,

I pray to you oh God.

 

When morning comes,

And the day has just begun,

I call to you oh God.

 

When morning comes,

And the day has just begun,

I listen to you my God.

 

When morning comes,

And the day has just begun,

I seek for you oh God.

 

When morning comes,

And the day has just begun,

I entrust my day to you my God.

 

When morning comes,

And the day has just begun,

May my deeds be pleasing to you.

 

When morning comes,

And the day has just begun,

Lead me not into temptation.

 

When morning comes,

And the day has just begun,

May your will be done.

 

When morning comes,

And the day has just begun,

Protect me from harm and danger.

 

When morning comes,

And the day has just begun,

Father bless me with your abundance.

 

When morning comes,

And the day has just begun,

Revitalize me and keep me in good health.

 

When morning comes,

And the day has just begun,

Break me away from the bondage of indebtedness.

 

When morning comes,

And the day has just begun,

May I help the less privileged

 

When morning comes,

And the day has just begun,

May I begin by praising you.

 

When morning comes,

And the day has just begun,

Show me your love.

 

When morning comes,

And the day has just begun,

Fill me with your peace.

 

When morning comes,

And the day has just begun,

May I see your kindness around me.

 

When morning comes,

And the day has just begun,

Glory to you Father in Heaven.

 

When morning comes,

And the day has just begun,

there are countless blessings I need to see.

 

When morning comes,

And the day has just begun,

thank you oh Father for this life.

 

When morning comes,

And the day has just begun,

bless my love ones.

 

When morning comes,

And the day has just begun,

bless my family and friends.

 

When morning comes,

And the day has just begun,

bless my children.

 

When morning comes,

And the day has just begun,

I draw your strength despite my weaknesses.

 

When morning comes,

And the day has just begun,

I want to end the day with you.

 

.

item.title: Protect My Children Father
item.dc:creator: brodneil
item.content:encoded:
Father I entrust to you the safety of my children.

 

As they cry at night,

As they lie in bed,

I entrust to you my children.

 

As they go to school,

As they make friends,

Bless my children Father.

 

As they go to work,

As they dance and sing,

Be with them Father.

 

As they build a family,

And as they make a career,

I entrust to you Father my children.

 

As they struggle in life,

And face its challenges,

I do believe you are there with them.

 

Bless them with good health, peace of mind, love, and abundance.

Father they are your children, even before they are mine.

Bless them and keep them under your protection.

 

May they feel your love more than they feel my love for them.

 

Father I entrust to you the safety of my children.

 

As they play,

Bless them with happiness.

 

As they pray,

Kindly hear them.

 

As they watch videos,

Give them wisdom and understanding.

 

As they travel,

Guide them.

 

Father I entrust to you the safety of my children.

 

When they cry, I know you listen.

When they laugh, I know you laugh with them.

When they pray, I know you have already answered them.

 

Father I entrust to you the safety of my children.

 

Father, please hear my prayer.

I am but a steward, a parent.

You created them and to you they will return.

 

Father I entrust to you the safety of my children.

 

Without you I can't protect them.

My knowledge, my skill, my power...

they are useless without you.

 

All I have is this prayer.

May my love for them be enough for you to protect them.

 

Father I entrust to you the safety of my children.

 

May my children please you.

May they glorify you.

May they be faithful stewards and parents when their time comes.

 

Father I entrust to you the safety of my children.

item.title: May This Day Be
item.dc:creator: brodneil
item.content:encoded:
May this day be filled with your love.

May this day be filled with blessings.

 

Life is a bit too short,

When years are spent in gladness.

 

Life can be too lonely and sad,

When your door is shut from friends.

 

May this day be filled with your peace,

So I may be a comfort to many.

 

May this day be filled with your compassion,

so I may share them to the needy.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: May this day be filled with Your blessings oh Lord. At times when you do not have the words to pray, may this be of help.

item.title: Prayer of Surrender
item.dc:creator: brodneil
item.content:encoded:
Worry is not something you can conquer,

Unless you surrender it to a higher power.

 

Fear is not something you can easily let go,

Unless you rely on a greater power.

 

Despair is not uncommon,

Unless you entrust your life to a divine source.

 

To you oh God, I surrender my life,

my family,

my dreams,

my struggles,

my worries.

 

To you oh God, I find freedom

As I surrender and entrust to you everything.

 

Father in Heaven, may you accept my whole-hearted surrender.

I know that you are righteous.

And in your righteousness, everything will be just fine.
item.excerpt:encoded: This is a prayer of surrender. Entrusting everything to God is not at all weak. It can be the bravest thing you can do in your life.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: This is a prayer of surrender. Entrusting everything to God is not at all weak. It can be the bravest thing you can do in your life.

item.title: Don't Grieve, Just Believe
item.dc:creator: brodneil
item.content:encoded:
Do not grieve,

for the joy of the Lord is your strength.

Just believe,

blessings are just at arm's length.

 

Do not grieve,

when you lost a job today.

Just believe,

more opportunities are coming your way.

 

Do not grieve,

when the future seems dull and dim.

Just believe,

God is simply teaching you to trust him.

 

Do not grieve,

if your plan fails.

Just believe,

a faithful person always prevails.

 

Do not grieve,

when sadness blankets your sleep.

Just believe,

that a great harvest you shall soon reap.

 

Do not grieve,

if the sun begins to set.

Just believe,

there is still a sunrise you should not forget.

 

Do not grieve,

when a friend turns his back.

Just believe,

it is not you who will lack.

 

Do not grieve,

when finances seem not enough.

Just believe,

even the calm seas are sometimes rough.

 

Do not grieve,

when relationships seem cold.

Just believe,

in time they'll turn into gold.

 

Do not grieve,

when you lose a friend.

Just believe,

you'll see him again in the end.

 

Do not grieve,

when pessimism seems to rule.

Just believe,

and keep your cool.

 

Do not grieve,

if you'd ever lose a house.

Just believe,

your home is your spouse.

 

Do not grieve,

if your partner leaves you.

Just believe,

someday she'll regret it cause you are one of the few.

 

Do not grieve,

when sickness occurs.

Just believe,

God's healing can dispel sickness or curse.

 

Do not grieve,

when you are wrongly accused.

Just believe,

and seek help from a just God who does not refuse.

 

Do not grieve,

even with hard work, suffering doesn't alleviate.

Just believe,

God's promises of abundance he shall not deviate.

 

May this be my prayer of belief.

With you my God, there is no room for grief.

May this prayer be my act of faith.

With you Father, in abundance, I bathe.

item.title: Morning Prayer: Good Morning Father
item.dc:creator: brodneil
item.content:encoded:
Good morning Father.

Thank you for this gift of life.

 

Bless me as I work and make a living.

Bless me that I may be productive and fruitful today.

 

May I show compassion to do those who need them.

And may I be firm when I need to.

 

May I speak with prudence.

May I see things with wisdom.

 

Bless me and guide me as I try to walk with you today.

Good morning Father.

item.title: Life Coaching Core Belief
item.dc:creator: brodneil
item.content:encoded:
Life coaching presuppositions

Create the proper dispositions.

There are yet 5 I know;

Kindly check them below:

There is no such thing as bad intention;

It might just be a wrong inclination.

The past does not dictate the future;

Anyone can recreate life into a new adventure.

The belief that one is broken

Does not help anyone from becoming open.

Everything is achievable;

Believing, that in a matter of time, it can be doable.

Empower your ability

By taking a responsibility.

Those five,

Are just part of the hive.

Tools and instruments,

Yet nothing more than condiments.

Fulfillment in life,

Can only come from the one who gives you life.

item.title: Deuteronomy Chapter 8:2-3 What is humility?
item.dc:creator: brodneil
item.content:encoded:
2 And thou shalt remember all the way which the LORD thy God hath led thee these forty years in the wilderness, that He might afflict thee, to prove thee, to know what was in thy heart, whether thou wouldest keep His commandments, or no.

3 And He afflicted thee, and suffered thee to hunger, and fed thee with manna, which thou knewest not, neither did thy fathers know; that He might make thee know that man doth not live by bread only, but by every thing that proceedeth out of the mouth of the LORD doth man live.

item.title: Factors that Impede our Learning and Listening
item.dc:creator: brodneil
item.content:encoded:
Won't you learn, won't you listen?

What keeps you from learning?

Won't you learn, won't you listen?

What keeps you from listening?

 

Above is a short poem I created, begging the question why people can't learn or listen.

I think there are two types of learning and listening:

  • The first is learning and listening with our intelligence; and
  • The second is a spirit filled learning and listening, which can only be achieved if we are filled by the spirit of YHWH.

Impediments to learning and listening with our intelligence

These are my reflections, notes, and understanding after listening to one of Kaim Ramsay's video on how our learning and listening with our intelligence can be prevented.

Gerard Egan (1994)
Skilled Helper: Problem-Management and Opportunity-Development Approach to Helping

  • External Factors
    • There are always external factors that can impede our learning capability.
    • Ex. surrounding noises
  • Response Rehearsal
    • Response rehearsal happens from the inside in relation to what is happening in the outside.
    • This also impedes learning and listening.
    • Ex. While someone is explaining to you, you are already doing an internal rebuttal instead of trying to understand what he/she is saying.
  • Fact Finding
    • When people pays attention more on fact finding instead of gaining, this impedes learning and listening.
    • Understanding how to apply is more important than just the information regardless of the volume of information.
    • Ex. When one is focused on getting facts or proofs to support/prove the other person's ideas instead of listening and gaining from the experience (regardless if factual).
  • Being Judgmental
    • How I present what I say does not change my intention.
    • Being judgmental assumes that the motive is bad.
    • How would you like being judged?
    • If you want to have a good relationship with others, give people the benefit of the doubt.
    • Ex. If you believe that you are better than the other person, you sometimes block yourself from learning and listening to him.
  • Problem Solving
    • Life coaching is not about problem solving.
    • It is about taking responsibility so you can be empowered.
    • It is not the role of the life coach to solve your problems.
    • The life coach is your companion while you solve your issues offering words of wisdom and support.
    • Ex. When all you want is to solve the other's problems instead of really trying to listen and being there with the person.  Doing a solution becomes more important than being there with the person.
    • Try to think: Why are we called human beings, and not human doings?  Perhaps, to be truly human, being there for someone is more important than doing for someone.
  • Imposing Personal View
    • Personal views are just opinions.
    • Opinions are not necessarily true; they are opinions.
    • Opinions are nothing more but a medium of either the truth or ignorance.
    • Ex.  Your opinion about religion may be true or not... it is merely an opinion.  

Impediment to a spirit filled learning and listening

The worst impediment to learning and listening is our inability to accept that there is a power greater than us and, in fact, a power greater than any other power.  This impediment can also be called our pride.

To acknowledge this power is to open the threshold of our heart into accepting our humanity.  It paves the way for humility; and then repentance.    Repentance and humility can then empower you to listen and learn from Holy Spirit.
item.excerpt:encoded: What can impede our learning and listening?

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: What can impede our learning and listening?

item.title: Let This Be My Prayer
item.dc:creator: brodneil
item.content:encoded:
Let this be my prayer,

while I read through the texts below I declare.

 

Don't bow down to idols;

It's written in the Bible.

Observe the Sabbath;

It is the right path.

 

Keep the commandments;

And you'll be surprise with your achievements.

Your yield shall increase;

And there will be peace.

 

You shall dwell in your land safely.

And your enemies shall fall surely.

God keeps His promises;

And He grants our wishes.

 

For it is written:

"I will walk among you and I will be your God; and you shall be my people."

 

Let this be my prayer,

while I read through the texts above I declare.

item.title: Prayer to Keep God's Commandments
item.dc:creator: brodneil
item.content:encoded:
May we hear your voice oh God and keep your commandments.

Your promises in Deuteronomy 28, how we wish to attain.

May we hear your voice oh God and keep your commandments.

May blessings overtake us instead of debts.

 

May we hear your voice oh God and keep your commandments.

May we be blessed wherever we go.

May we hear your voice oh God and keep your commandments.

May we be abundantly productive throughout the generations.

 

May we hear your voice oh God and keep your commandments.

May you oh God be our defender and protector.

May we hear your voice oh God and keep your commandments.

May all see that you are our God and we are your people.

 

May we hear your voice oh God and keep your commandments.

May this be a prayer to keep your commandments.

item.title: Prayer for Prosperity
item.dc:creator: brodneil
item.content:encoded:
Bless me with prosperity oh God.

May I be fruitful in what I do.

Bless me with prosperity oh God.

May I replicate the creativity in you.

 

Bless me with prosperity oh God.

May abundance flow and overtake me.

Bless me with prosperity oh God.

May I be a living witness of your providence for people to see.

 

Bless me with prosperity oh God.

May I feed the hungry.

Bless me with prosperity oh God.

May I be an instrument of healing.

 

Bless me with prosperity oh God,

So I may bring hope to the desperate.

Bless me with prosperity oh God,

So the weary may find respite.

 

Bless me with prosperity oh God,

So the indebted may be free.

Bless me with prosperity oh God,

So the bad elements may flee.

 

Bless me with prosperity oh God.

May this blessing be upon my descendants throughout the generations.

Bless me with prosperity oh God.

May my descendants serve you with dedication.

 

May this prayer for prosperity materialize oh God,

that others may see your greatness and majesty.

item.title: God Answers Prayers
item.dc:creator: brodneil
item.content:encoded:
God answers prayers.

Don't you know?

 

God answers prayers.

Believe that He cares.

 

God answers prayers.

Listen and you'll know He's there.

 

God answers prayers,

Though it might be a yes or a no.

 

God answers prayers.

God knows what is best for you.

 

God answers prayers.

Be clear on your intentions.

 

God answers prayers.

And believe that you receive them.

 

And whatsoever you desire, believe that you receive them, and you shall have them.

item.title: You Put Words Into My Mouth
item.dc:creator: brodneil
item.content:encoded:
You put words into my mouth as I pray.

How your spirit guide me in prayer.

May you be glorified forever.

 

At night I awake and hear your voice.

You put words into my heart to pray.

May you be glorified forever.

item.title: Lord, Lord, Who Are You?
item.dc:creator: brodneil
item.content:encoded:
You call me, "Lord, lord."

Who are you?

 

Yes, you did miracles in my name.

Who are you?

 

Yes, you prophesied in my name.

But who are you?

 

Yes, you cast out demons in my name.

But who are you?

 

I don't know you.

I never knew you.

 

You call me lord, lord.

Did you do my Father's will?

 

It's like saying:

"Lord, lord, who are you?"
item.excerpt:encoded: Lip service cannot save you. Calling "Lord, lord" does not guarantee you the kingdom of heaven. It is by doing the Father's will that you may enter God's kingdom through his messiah, Yeshua (Jesus).

item.title: Thank You God
item.dc:creator: brodneil
item.content:encoded:
Thank you oh God for the day.

Thank you for providing for us.

Thank you for our livelihood.

Thank you for good health.

Thank you for friends.

Thank you for my physical qualities.

Thank you God for my love ones.

Thank you for the good weather.

Thank you for the dreams and ambitions.

 

Thank you oh God.

item.title: Hanukkah
item.dc:creator: brodneil
item.content:encoded:
Hanukkah is the rededication of the temple. 

Hanukkah is not actually a mo'edim, that is the appointed times of YHWH.  You can find the detailed list of mo'edim at Leviticus 23.

Though Hanukkah is not a mo'edim, it is not wrong to celebrate Hanukkah.  In the same way that others are not also obliged to celebrate Hanukkah.

item.title: Sin Is Real
item.dc:creator: brodneil
item.content:encoded:
Sin is real. And it is as real as virus.

Sin is not always like a black dot on a very white bond paper where you can easily find and see.

Sin can creep deep inside your heart and soul like a virus.  It can be unseen by the naked eye. 

You know you are sick though without having to see the virus; you can feel and experience its effects: the pain, the discomfort, the irritability, and so on.  I think you get what I mean: that sin can be felt and experienced by the sinner, as well as the other people surrounding him/her (the sinner).

There might be times when you think that sin is as integral as your internal organs.  You might think that you can't leave without it.

Like a virus, everyone can have it:  

For all have sinned, and come short of the glory of YAH (God).

Romans 3:23

Yet you can always live a life away from sin through Yeshua the Messiah (Jesus Christ).  

3 For I delivered unto you first of all that which I also received, how that Mashiach (Messiah) died for our sins according to the scriptures;

4 And that he was buried, and that he rose again the third day according to the Scriptures:

1 Corinthians 15:3-4

Human as we are, we can fail; yet time and again we can always, and without delay, repent and seek God's grace.    

And if you think that you can do away with sin by your own might, you are fooling yourself.  Eventually you'll realize that without the grace of God, you are a slave to sin.

9 The heart is deceitful above all things, and desperately wicked: who can know it?

10 I YHWH search the heart, I try the mind, even to give every man according to his ways, and according to the fruit of his doings.

Jeremiah 17:9-10

We often fall short of the grace of God, because we are too often deceived by that which we call free will.  The free will to listen and to heed to our heart's desires and deceptions. 

15 And he said unto them, ye are they which justify yourselves before men; but YAH (God) knows your hearts: for that which is highly esteemed among men is abomination in the sight of YHWH.

Luke 16:15

Man is often deceived by the mundane happiness and riches; And that in the end, he realizes that he was just fooled into sinning.

Sin can have many faces.  It can be an innocent looking girl;  it can be a cause worth fighting; or it can be a religion worth defending.  

If you still think that you are without sin, or blameless in the sight of God --- can you identify yourself in any of these?

21 For from within, out of the heart of men, proceed evil thoughts, adulteries, fornications, murders,

22 Thefts, covetousness, wickedness, deceit, lasciviousness, an evil eye, blasphemy, pride, foolishness:

23 All these evil things come from within, and defile the man.

Mark 7:21-23

We can commit a sin by the things we do and by not doing the good that we are supposed to do.

Therefore to him that knows to do good, and does it not,  to him it is sin.

James 5:17

Therefore if you say that you've not sinned, better be sure that you are not fooling yourself.  

8 If we say that we have no sin, we deceive ourselves, and the Truth is not in us.

9 If we confess our sins, he is faithful and just to forgive us our sins, and to cleanse us from all unrighteousness.

1 John 1:8-9

Repent and forsake sin; there is a life worth living apart from sin.

Both body and soul will soon have to pay for the sins not repented.

You would know that you are living in sin because despite all the facade: accomplishments, riches,  friends, and luxury --- when you stare deep within you --- you are feeling like you are alone in the dark.

And when you feel like you are stuck with it, rejoice for that is when the Lord will work wonders in your life.  Rejoice for that is when Yeshua, our messiah, will deliver you from sin.

Do you remember the story of Gideon in Judges chapter 7?   

The Lord said to Gideon, "You have too many troops with you for Me to deliver Midian into their hands; Israel might claim for themselves the glory due to Me, thinking, 'Our own hand has brought us victory.' 

Judges 7:2

In the same way, rejoice then when you are left with nothing to conquer sin.  Rejoice then when you are left with no resources to stop drug addiction.  Rejoice then when you are left with no friends to console you.  Rejoice then  when you feel alone in the dark, for it is then that God will work with you.

Like Gideon's experience, he was left with 300 troops out of the 32,000 troops; and God provided them the victory.  

In the same way, we don't need 32,000 troops.  What we might consider as strength might just be our weakness.  And what we might consider as our weakness might be the only thing needed to win over sin.

If you feel alone and defeated in trying to fight over a vice, a circumstance, or a sin --- you simply have to surrender yourself (your life, your nothingness, and your whole being) to God through Yeshua the Messiah (Jesus Christ).  That is all that it takes; and you will come out victorious through Him who will strengthen you.

Sin hinders you to fully reach your potential, and that is becoming a child of God.

item.title: Expect for Blessings; Don't Hope for Them
item.dc:creator: brodneil
item.content:encoded:
Have you tried ordering online?  

Scenario 1:

After ordering from an ecommerce shop, which you have not heard before, I am sure you'll be hoping that the product would arrive.  There might be doubt and you'll blame yourself along the way while waiting for the product to arrive.  But because you can't find that product anywhere else, then you had to order and purchase it from that online shop. 

Scenario 2:

After ordering from a credible ecommerce shop, you'll expect for the product to arrive soon.  It is not about hoping anymore.  It would be more of an active expectation.

When praying to the Father through His son Yeshua our Messiah (Jesus Christ), expect for the blessings to arrive.  Expect for the blessings because you are getting them from the source: from the creator of the universe, from the source of all goodness and love, from your loving Father.  Expect for the blessings because no matter how big or how impossible they may seem to be, they have been purchased by the blood of Yeshua the messiah (Jesus Christ).   If you believe in Yeshua and take him in your life as your messiah (savior) and Lord, then you'll have unlimited access to blessings because he has purchased them all for you beforehand.  You only need to ask him for those blessings.

From there, the waiting becomes more exciting.  And if you continue doing this, everyday you'll be expecting for blessings; and life would be more exciting.
item.excerpt:encoded: Expect for blessings. They have already been purchased by the blood of Yeshua our messiah for you. Expect for unlimeted blessings.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Expect for blessings. They have already been purchased by the blood of Yeshua our messiah for you. Expect for unlimeted blessings.

item.title: This Generation Shall Not Pass, Till All These Things Fulfilled
item.dc:creator: brodneil
item.content:encoded:
If you have been reading the Bible for sometime now or at least read about messianic prophecies, for sure, you must have encountered this bible line or verse: "This generation shall not pass, till all these things be fulfilled."

Let me show you the different translations of these Bible passage to compare:

Truly, I say to you, this generation will not pass away until all these things take place.

Matthew 24:34 English Standard Version (ESV)

Verily I say unto you, This generation shall not pass, till all these things be fulfilled.

Matthew 24:34 King James Version (KJV)

Truly I tell you, this generation will certainly not pass away until all these things have happened.

Matthew 24:34 New International Version

Amein I say unto you, This nation shall not pass, till all these things be fulfilled.

Matthew 24:34 CEPHER Abridged

This Bible passage is about the Lesson of the Fig Tree.  My concern is on verse 32.  Somehow there are quite a number of Bible translations:

Amein I say unto you, This nation shall not pass away, till all be fulfilled.

Luke 21:32 CEPHER Abridged

I prefer the above translation; however, knowing the truth of the Scripture is not about what we prefer or like.  Therefore, the reason for this post --- that is to know what Yeshua meant.  Would it mean that he had a wrong prophecy?  Is Yeshua subject to Deuteronomy 18:22?

If the prophet speaks in the name of the LORD and the oracle was not spoken by the LORD; the prophet has uttered it presumptuously: do not stand in dread of him.

Deuteronomy 18:22

Remember that all these things will take place before the people now living have all died.  

Luke 21:32 Good News Bible

Truly I tell you, this generation will certainly not pass away until all these things have happened.

Luke 21: 32 New International Version

What does the word generation mean?  Does it mean an average lifespan of a group of people?  Or can it also mean nation as the CEPHER translated it.  Below is a commentary from Jamieson-Fausset-Brown:

32. This generation—not "this nation," as some interpret it, which, though admissible in itself, seems very unnatural here. It is rather as in Lu 9:27.

Jamieson-Fausset-Brown Bible Commentary﻿

Number 30

Pslam 95 

Hebrews 30

item.content:encoded:
How are you fallen from heaven, O Heylel, son of the howling morning.

Isaiah 14:12  (CEPHER) 

Heylel (הילל) could mean the howling.  Kindly check the explanation in this video.

item.title: Day 20
item.dc:creator: brodneil
item.content:encoded:
Challenge:

  • Do you acknowledge your sins?
  • We can only repent if we accept that we have sinned.
  • Try your best to be humble during the day, knowing that we too are sinners.
  • Optional: Your feedback using the comment section below is highly appreciated.

Further Reading:

  • Start with Day 1 on the Bible Verse of the Day Challenge
  • Sin Is Real

item.title: Day 21
item.dc:creator: brodneil
item.content:encoded:
Challenge:

  • Do we entrust our lives and our needs to God?
  • Do we glorify Him as God despite our problems and challenges?
  • Are we thankful to the graces we have received from God, be it small or big?
  • The challenge: Glorify God and Thank Him for everything throughout the day.
  • Optional: Your feedback using the comment section below is highly appreciated.

Further Reading:

  • Start with Day 1 on the Bible Verse of the Day Challenge
  • Sin Is Real
item.excerpt:encoded: This verse shows us what sins men committed during the beginning of time. In fact, it seems that men never have truly learned from it.

item.title: Day 25: Do What Is Good
item.dc:creator: brodneil
item.content:encoded:
Challenge:

  • Do what you think is good.
  • Refrain not from doing what you know is good.
  • When someone needs help, and you know it is good to help --- then help.
  • Optional: Your feedback using the comment section below is highly appreciated.

Further Reading:

  • Start with Day 1 on the Bible Verse of the Day Challenge
  • Sin Is Real
item.excerpt:encoded: Therefore to him that knows to do good, and does it not, to him it is sin. Refrain not from doing what you know is good.
